author: MSNBC.com
title: Remembering music industry giants Little Richard and Andre Harrell
description: In his final thoughts, Rev. Al Sharpton recounts the contributions of Little Richard and Andre Harrell to music and more.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Symptoms to look for in possible coronavirus-related children's disease
description: New York is investigating up to 85 possible coronavirus-related cases in children. NBC News’ Dr. Natalie Azar discusses the possible symptoms and how long it may take for officials to find out exactly what it is.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Restaurateur Danny Meyer: The industry was ‘not in good shape’ even pre-pandemic
description: Union Square Hospitality Group CEO Danny Meyer and KIND Snacks founder and executive chairman Daniel Lubetzky on the food service industry’s response to coronavirus.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Nikole Hannah-Jones: ‘Black Americans do not have the presumption of innocence’
description: Pulitzer Prize-winning creator of The New York Times’ ‘1619 Project’ Nikole Hannah-Jones discusses the shootings of Ahmaud Arbery in Satilla Shores, GA and Sean Reed in Indianapolis, IN.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Universal basic income would give Americans ‘breathing room’ during the crisis
description: Springboard to Opportunities CEO Aisha Nyandoro discusses the results of her organization’s guaranteed income program for mothers in Jackson, MS and why we can’t afford to stigmatize poverty during the pandemic.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Velshi: Trump’s veto of the Iran resolution shows his disregard for the Constitution
description: MSNBC’s Ali Velshi explains how Trump’s refusal to seek Congressional approval for a war on Iran threatens our system of checks and balances.
source.name: MSNBC

title: Long lines and bustling business as beachgoers return to Maryland boardwalk
description: NBC's Julia Jester reports from Ocean City, Maryland, where the boardwalk has reopened for the first time since the coronavirus pandemic began. To enforce social distancing, lines for some businesses are so long, they reach the parking lot.
source.name: MSNBC

title: Burr, brother-in-law sold stock on same pre-pandemic crash day
description: Coronavirus-related stock sales are suspected to have been made by Sen. Richard Burr and his brother-in-law after the two men sold stock on the same day before the pandemic sparked a stock market crash. Joy Reid and her panel discuss the ongoing probe.
